member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.DateRangeCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Retrieves an IEnumerator object for the entire collection.
member.returns: An IEnumerator object for the entire collection
member.remarks:
Enumerators are intended to be used only to read data in the collection. Enumerators cannot be used to modify the underlying collection.
The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection.
When an enumerator is instantiated, it takes a snapshot of the current state of the collection. If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the snapshot gets out of sync and the enumerator throws an InvalidOperationException. Two enumerators instantiated from the same collection at the same time can have different snapshots of the collection.

member.returns: true if the specified theme is a dark theme; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.GetIsAnimationEnabled(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Returns whether animation is enabled on the specified visual, also verifying that system animation is supported.
member.param: The to examine.
member.returns: true if animation is enabled on the specified visual; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method examines the visual to see if its attached ThemeProperties.IsAnimationEnabled property is true, and that the visual is currently loaded in UI, if it is a . Finally the property is checked to ensure the system supports animation.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.RegisterAutomaticThemes(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers the theme names that should be automatically set to based on and changes to that property.
member.param: The theme name to use when system settings indicate applications should use a light theme.
The theme name to use when system settings indicate applications should use a dark theme.
The theme name to use when system settings indicate a high contrast system theme is active.
member.remarks:
The theme names passed into this method should be names of themes registered via .
A null reference may be passed into any of this method's parameters to prevent automatic changes when the related changes are detected.
For instance, if you only wish to handle the system settings' light/dark application setting, but never want to support a high contrast theme, call this method specifying registered theme names for the first two parameters, but pass a null reference to the parameter.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.ThemeManager.UnregisterAutomaticThemes

member.summary: A custom theme. No special default theme definition is set for this theme name since it is purely intended for a custom theme definition.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.ThemeNames.HighContrast
member.summary: A special theme that is made purely of system colors, and is only meant for usage when the operating system is in high-contrast mode.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.ThemeNames.Office2010Black
member.summary: A theme that mimics the black Office 2010 Aero-style appearance. The default implementation of this theme is in a separate ActiproSoftware.Themes.Aero.Wpf assembly and requires a special ThemesAeroThemeCatalogRegistrar.Register() method call prior to use.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChrome.CloseCommand
member.summary: Gets the used to close a window.
member.value: The used to close a window.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChrome.CornerKind
member.summary: Gets or sets the kind of system-rendered corner kind, which can also affect border and drop shadow rendering.
member.value: A indicating the kind of system-rendered corner kind, which can also affect border and drop shadow rendering. The default value is Rounded.
member.remarks:
This property only affects Windows 11 or later systems. When set to a non-Square value, the Windows system will apply a corner radius to the window and will render the window's border and drop shadow natively. In that scenario, WindowChrome does not render a drop shadow.
On Windows 10 or earlier systems, the corner kind is always treated as Square regardless of this property setting.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChrome.HasCloseButton
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window is capable of displaying a close button.
member.value: true if the window is capable of displaying a close button; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChrome.HasIcon
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window is capable of displaying a title bar icon.
member.value: true if the window is capable of displaying a title bar icon; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChrome.HasMaximizeButton
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window is capable of displaying a maximize button.
member.value: true if the window is capable of displaying a maximize button; otherwise, false. The default value is null, meaning base the value on the window's ResizeMode setting.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChrome.HasMinimizeButton
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window is capable of displaying a minimize button.
member.value: true if the window is capable of displaying a minimize button; otherwise, false. The default value is null, meaning base the value on the window's ResizeMode setting.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChrome.HasOuterGlow
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window has an outer glow / drop shadow.
member.value: true if the window has an outer glow / drop shadow; otherwise, false. The default value is null, meaning use the current theme's default.
member.remarks:
When this property resolves to true, WindowChrome will render a drop shadow outside of the normal outer window border and window resizing will be supported over a portion of that shadow.
If on a Windows 11 system or later and the property is set to a non-Square value, the Windows system will render the drop shadow natively instead of WindowChrome rendering a drop shadow. This HasOuterGlow property can be kept true to ensure that window resizing can still occur over the system-rendered drop shadow.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChrome.HasRestoreButton
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window is capable of displaying a restore button.
member.value: true if the window is capable of displaying a restore button; otherwise, false. The default value is null, meaning base the value on the window's ResizeMode setting.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChrome.HasTitleBar
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the window is capable of displaying a title bar.
member.value: true if the window is capable of displaying a title bar; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

member.value: The window's icon margin. The default value is 8, 2, 8, 2.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeCornerKind
member.summary: Specifies the kind of system-rendered corner kind, which can also affect border and drop shadow rendering.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeCornerKind.Square
member.summary: A square window chrome corner with an Actipro-rendered border and drop shadow.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeCornerKind.Rounded
member.summary: A large rounded window chrome corner where the system renders the border and drop shadow. This is the preferred setting for normal windows in Windows 11 or later. If this value is set on Windows 10 and earlier, it will be coerced to Square.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeCornerKind.SmallRounded
member.summary: A small rounded window chrome corner where the system renders the border and drop shadow. This is the preferred setting for tool windows in Windows 11 or later. If this value is set on Windows 10 and earlier, it will be coerced to Square.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeElementKind
member.summary: Specifies the result of a hit test operation within a custom window chrome.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeElementKind.Unknown
member.summary: Assume client area.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeElementKind.NonClientArea
member.summary: Non-client area, continue recursing into other elements.

member.summary: Client area, stop recursing.

member.summary: Title bar area, stop recursing.

member.summary: Restore title bar button, stop recursing.

member.summary: Close title bar button, stop recursing.

member.summary: System menu icon, stop recursing.

member.summary: Resize grip, stop recursing.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeTitleBarMergeKind
member.summary: Specifies how a window's content area can be merged into its title bar area when using .

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeTitleBarMergeKind.None
member.summary: The title bar area and content areas remain fully separate. The title bar renders its own background, while the Window.Background brush renders the content area background.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeTitleBarMergeKind.BackgroundOnly
member.summary: The title bar area and content areas remain separate. However the Window.Background brush renders both the title bar area and content area backgrounds.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeTitleBarMergeKind.ContentOnly
member.summary: The content area renders within the title bar area. The Window.Background brush continues to only render outside of the title bar, allowing the title bar to render like normal, but with the content area elements overlaying it.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.WindowChromeTitleBarMergeKind.Full
member.summary: The content area renders within the title bar area. The Window.Background brush renders both the title bar area and content area backgrounds.

member.summary: The glyph renders with an accent color.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.ThemeIntent.White
member.summary: A very light theme where near-white colors are used in most of the user interface.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.ThemeIntent.Light
member.summary: A light theme where silver colors are used in most of the user interface.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.ThemeIntent.Dark
member.summary: A dark theme where gray colors are used in most of the user interface.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.ThemeIntent.Black
member.summary: A very dark theme where near-black colors are used in most of the user interface.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.ThemeIntent.HighContrast
member.summary: A theme that only utilizes system colors and is intended for when Windows' "high contrast" mode is active.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.WindowBorderKind
member.summary: Specifies the kind of a window border.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.WindowBorderKind.LowContrast
member.summary: A low-contrast color relative to the theme base color, allowing it to subtly stand out from the window background.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.WindowBorderKind.MidContrast
member.summary: A medium-contrast color relative to the theme base color, allowing it to stand out from the window background.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.WindowBorderKind.Accent
member.summary: An accent color.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.WindowTitleBarBackgroundKind
member.summary: Specifies the kind of a window title bar background.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.WindowTitleBarBackgroundKind.Window
member.summary: The window background color, allowing the title bar to seamlessly transition to the window content. The active and inactive window title bar background colors are the same.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.WindowTitleBarBackgroundKind.ThemeMinimum
member.summary: The minimum theme color, which is white in lighter themes and near black in darker themes. The active and inactive window title bar background colors are the same.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.WindowTitleBarBackgroundKind.Accent
member.summary: An accent color. The active and inactive window title bar background colors are the same.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Themes.Generation.WindowTitleBarBackgroundKind.AccentWithDimming
member.summary: An accent color. The inactive window title bar background color is a desaturated version of the active window title bar background color.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.BorderChildClipConverter
member.summary: Represents a multi-value converter that can be applied to a Border.Child element's Clip property to ensure the child element is properly clipped based on the Border.CornerRadius value.
member.remarks: This converter is useful when the Border.Child element or another element within its hierarchy has a background that renders into the portion of the parent Border that is normally rounded off by the corner radius.

example.code: <Border x:Name="outerBorder" BorderBrush="Black" BorderThickness="1" CornerRadius="8"> <Grid> <Grid.Clip> <MultiBinding Converter="{StaticResource BorderClipConverter}"> <Binding RelativeSource="{RelativeSource Self}" Path="ActualWidth" /> <Binding RelativeSource="{RelativeSource Self}" Path="ActualHeight" /> <Binding ElementName="outerBorder" Path="BorderThickness" /> <Binding ElementName="outerBorder" Path="CornerRadius" /> </MultiBinding> </Grid.Clip> <!-- Grid child controls here --> </Grid> </Border>

The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: A converted value.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.GetScalePathPath(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a scale-oriented path part as appropriate for raster images whose sources have a .
member.param: The scale to examine.
member.returns: The scale-oriented path part that was generated.
member.remarks: This method is called by to assist in building the for locating a scale-oriented variant of an image. The default implementation of this method returns an empty string if the value is 1.0 or is not within the collection. If the is found within the collection, a string such as "Scale-200" would be returned for a scale 2.0.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.GetThemeNamePathPart(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a theme name-oriented path part as appropriate for raster images whose sources have a .
member.param: The theme name to examine.
member.returns: The theme name-oriented path part that was generated.
member.remarks: This method is called by to assist in building the for locating a theme name-oriented variant of an image. The default implementation of this method returns an empty string if the value is not within the collection. If the is found within the collection, a string such as "Theme-Dark" would be returned for a theme name "Dark". Note that spaces in the theme name are removed.

member.summary: Transforms the source for raster images to locate other variations based on theme name and scale.

An that contains request information.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.ChromaticAdaptationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the chromatic adaptation (color shifting) mode to apply to images.
member.value: An indicating the chromatic adaptation (color shifting) mode to apply to images. The default value is Never.
member.remarks: Chromatic adaptation is the process of taking an image designed for a light theme and dynamically creating a variation of it that renders clearly on a specified background color, sometimes adjusting the brightness and hue as needed. This feature is useful when wanting to have a single set of original images that can be adjusted at run-time to render well in dark themes. This feature should not be used if are used, where specific images are supplied for alternate themes like dark themes. This value should be set prior to UI being loaded.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.Default
member.summary: Gets or sets the default instance.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.DesignForegroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a Color used in images that when specified, can be swapped out with a Color specified in .
member.value: A Color used in images that when specified, can be swapped out with a Color specified in .
member.remarks: This property should generally only be specified when using monochrome vector icons. Specifying a value allows images to switch their foreground dynamically based on a containing control's state (normal, highlighted, etc.). This is necessary when the foreground of the containing control changes drastically and requires an image's foreground to also change to retain a proper contrast ratio.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.MonochromeBrightnessThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the brightness threshold to use when generating monochrome image variations.
member.value: The brightness threshold to use when generating monochrome image variations. The default value is 230.
member.remarks: Pixels with brightnesses at or above this threshold will be made transparent. Pixels with brightnesses below this threshold will be made a single opaque color, specified in . Set this value to 0 to prevent monochrome image variations from being supported. This value should be set prior to UI being loaded.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.Scales
member.summary: Gets the collection of high-DPI (non-100%) scales (e.g. 2.0 means 200% DPI) supported by raster images using this provider.
member.value: The collection of high-DPI (non-100%) scales (e.g. 2.0 means 200% DPI) supported by raster images using this provider.
member.remarks: Do not add 1.0 to this collection since it is the default scale. Add a 2.0 entry to tell the that there are specific high-DPI 200% scale variations of all raster images using this provider available. This value should be set prior to UI being loaded.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.ThemeNames
member.summary: Gets the collection of non-default theme names supported by raster images using this provider.
member.value: The collection of non-default theme names supported by raster images using this provider.
member.remarks: As an example, if the default application theme name is "Light" then exclude "Light" from this collection. Non-suffixed images will be used for any themes not in this collection. Add a "Dark" entry to tell the that there are specific "Dark" theme variations of all raster images using this provider available. This feature should not be used if is enabled. This value should be set prior to UI being loaded.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.UseMonochromeInHighContrast
member.summary: Gets or sets whether requests should use monochrome images in high-contrast themes.
member.value: true if requests should use monochrome images in high-contrast themes; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.CanAdaptProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CanAdapt dependency property. This field is read-only.
member.value: The identifier for the CanAdapt dependency property.
member.remarks: This attached property can be set on or objects to prevent monochrome conversion and chromatic adaptation. This is used for things like brush swatches in foreground/background selection images that must show their original designated color.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.ImageProvider.ProviderProperty
member.summary: Identifies the Provider dependency property. This field is read-only.
member.value: The identifier for the Provider dependency property.
member.remarks: This attached property can be set on objects to indicate an alternate to use, if not the default.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.VisualDescendantFilterBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the types of filter behaviors when searching down the visual tree.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.VisualDescendantFilterBehavior.ContinueSkipSelfAndChildren
member.summary: Indicates that the search should continue, but the current item and it's children should be skipped.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.VisualDescendantFilterBehavior.ContinueSkipChildren
member.summary: Indicates that the search should continue, but the current item's children should be skipped. The current item will still be tested.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.VisualDescendantFilterBehavior.ContinueSkipSelf
member.summary: Indicates that the search should continue, but the current item should be skipped. The current item's children will still be traversed and potentially tested.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.VisualDescendantFilterBehavior.Continue
member.summary: Indicates that the search should continue. The current item and it's children will still be traversed and potentially tested.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.VisualDescendantFilterBehavior.Stop
member.summary: Indicates that the search should be stopped and the current item should be returned.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.VisualResultBehavior
member.summary: Specifies the types of result behaviors when searching the visual tree.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.VisualResultBehavior.Stop
member.summary: Indicates that the search should be stopped and the current item should be returned.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.VisualResultBehavior.Continue
member.summary: Indicates that the search should be continue.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Media.Animation.Transition.GetOppositeTransition
member.summary: Returns a variation of the transition that can be used for backing out a content that was inserted into the presenter using this transition.
member.returns: A variation of the transition that can be used for backing out a content that was inserted into the presenter using this transition.
member.remarks:

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Extensions.OrientedElementExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods for the type .
member.remarks: Many of the methods refer to the terms 'extent' and 'ascent'. For elements with horizontal orientation, the extent is along the x-axis and the the ascent is along the y-axis. Conversely, for elements with vertical orientation, the ascent is along the x-axis and the the extent is along the y-axis.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Data.ConditionalConverter
member.summary: Represents a value and multi-value converter that provides if-else functionality for Binding and MultiBinding objects.
member.remarks:
This converter expects the following source values to be specified:
Condition - A value indicating whether the true or false value should be returned.
TrueValue - An that is returned when the Condition is true. This can be omitted if the FalseValue parameter is also omitted, in which case the value of the TrueValue property will be used.
FalseValue - An that is returned when the Condition is false. This can be omitted, in which case the value of the FalseValue property will be used.

example.code: <shared:ConditionalConverter x:Key="ConditionalConverter" TrueValue="The Value is true" FalseValue="The Value is false" /> ... <TextBlock Text="{Binding Path=BooleanProperty, Converter={StaticResource ConditionalConverter}}" />

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Data.ConditionalConverter.Convert(System.Object[],System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Returns either the second or third source value, based on the first source value.
member.param: The array of values that the source bindings in the produces.
The type of the binding target property.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: The second source value, if the first source value equals true; otherwise the third source value.
member.remarks: See for more information on the expected source values.

member.summary: This method always returns and should not be used.
member.param: Not used.
Not used.
Not used.
Not used.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Data.CornerRadiusConverter
member.summary: Represents a value converter that converts between a number and a .
member.remarks: By default, the returned will have all four corners (CornerRadius.BottomLeft, CornerRadius.BottomRight, CornerRadius.TopLeft, and CornerRadius.TopLeft) set to the specified number. An optional parameter of type can be specified, which can be used to customize the corners that are set.

example.code:
<shared:CornerRadiusConverter x:Key="CornerRadiusConverter" /> ... <!-- Set all four corners --> ... Value="{Binding Path=Number, Converter={StaticResource CornerRadiusConverter}}" ...
<!-- Only set the BottomLeft and BottomRight cornerss --> ... Value="{Binding Path=Number, Converter={StaticResource CornerRadiusConverter}, ConverterParameter='Bottom'}" ...

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Data.InverseConverter
member.summary: Represents a value converter that inverts another value converter.
member.remarks: This converter allows the logic of existing value converters to be reused in bindings that require the data conversion to be reversed. For example, if AToBConverter converts type A to type B, then wrapping it with an instance of InverseConverter it will convert from type B to type A. This allows AToBConverter to be used in a binding for properties of type A.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Data.ThicknessConverter
member.summary: Represents a value converter that converts between a number and a .
member.remarks: By default, the returned will have all four sides (Thickness.Left, Thickness.Top, Thickness.Right, and Thickness.Bottom) set to the specified number. An optional parameter of type can be specified, which can be used to customize the sides that are set.

example.code:
<shared:ThicknessConverter x:Key="ThicknessConverter" /> ... <!-- Set all four sides --> ... Value="{Binding Path=Number, Converter={StaticResource ThicknessConverter}}" ...
<!-- Only set the Left and Right sides --> ... Value="{Binding Path=Number, Converter={StaticResource ThicknessConverter}, ConverterParameter='Left,Right'}" ...

member.summary: The item passed all filter conditions and is included in the filter. Tree descendants will also be examined by the filter.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Data.Filtering.DataFilterResult.IncludedWithDescendants
member.summary: The item passed all filter conditions and is included in the filter. Tree descendants may also be examined by the filter, but only for determining if their ancestors require expansion. Tree descendants will be included in the filter regardless of their own filter result.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Data.Filtering.DataFilterResult.IncludedByDescendants
member.summary: The item did not pass all filter conditions and will only be included in the filter if one or more of its tree descendants are included. Tree descendants will also be examined by the filter.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Data.Filtering.DataFilterResult.Excluded
member.summary: The item did not pass all filter conditions and will not be included in the filter. None of its tree descendants will be examined by the filter.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.PopupButtonDisplayMode
member.summary: Specifies the display mode of a control.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.PopupButtonDisplayMode.Merged
member.summary: The control will show the content as a normal button, with a popup indicator on the right side. This display mode is also known as a drop-down button, and opens a popup/menu when clicked.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.PopupButtonDisplayMode.CenterMerged
member.summary: The control will show the content as a normal button, with a popup indicator right next to the content. This display mode is also known as a drop-down button, and opens a popup/menu when clicked.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.PopupButtonDisplayMode.Split
member.summary: The control will show the content in a normal button area and a popup indicator in a separate clickable area. This display mode is also known as a split button. It performs a standard button click when clicking the button's content area, and opens a popup/menu when the popup indicator area is clicked.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.PopupButtonDisplayMode.ButtonOnly
member.summary: The control will show the content as a normal button, and with no popup indicator. This display mode renders the same as a normal , while still retaining popup display functionality when clicked. If no popup content or menu is assigned to the control, clicks on the control will behave like a standard .

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.PopupButtonDisplayMode.PopupOnly
member.summary: The control will show the popup indicator, but not the content. This display mode opens a popup/menu when clicked.

member.value: The size of the knob element on the perpendicular axis. The default value is 12.
member.remarks: The largest possible value assigned to this property should also be assigned to .

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitch.KnobBorderThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness of the knob element border.
member.value: A for the knob element border.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitch.KnobCornerRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the corner radius of the knob element.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitch.KnobExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the knob element on the primary axis (i.e., width when horizontal, height when vertical).
member.value: The size of the knob element on the primary axis. The default value is 12.
member.remarks: The largest possible value assigned to this property should also be assigned to .

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitch.KnobMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the margin applied to knob element.
member.value: A for the margin of the knob element.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitch.KnobOpacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the knob element.
member.value: The opacity of the element, a value from 0 to 1. The default value is 1.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitch.KnobShadowDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the shadow for the knob element, in degrees, where 270 is down, 315 is lower-right, etc.
member.value: The direction of the shadow, in degrees. The default value is 270, meaning down.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitch.KnobShadowElevation
member.summary: Gets or sets the elevation of the shadow for the knob element, a value from 0 to 24.
member.value: The elevation of the shadow, a value from 0 to 24. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: Higher elevations render larger shadows. 0 doesn't render a shadow. The property must be set to for the shadow to render.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitch.KnobShadowOpacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the shadow for the knob element.
member.value: The opacity of the shadow, a value from 0 to 1. The default value is 0.3.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitch.MaxKnobAscent
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value which will be assigned to the property.
member.remarks: Assigning a value to this property is only necessary if the value of increases through user interaction (e.g., the ascent increases on mouse over) so that space is properly reserved in the layout to accommodate the maximum size.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitch.MaxKnobExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum value which will be assigned to the property.
member.remarks: Assigning a value to this property is only necessary if the value of increases through user interaction (e.g., the extent increases on mouse over) so that space is properly reserved in the layout to accommodate the maximum size.

member.value: The margin for near side content.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitchContentPlacement
member.summary: Indicates the placement of "on" and "off" content for a .

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitchContentPlacement.None
member.summary: Content will not be displayed.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitchContentPlacement.Near
member.summary: Content will be placed before the near side of the switch (e.g., left).

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitchContentPlacement.Far
member.summary: Content will be after the far side of the switch (e.g., right).

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitchContentPlacement.NearAndFar
member.summary: Content will be placed on both sides of the switch based on the corresponding position of the knob (e.g. "off" content before the near side of the switch and "on" content after the far side).

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ToggleSwitchContentPlacement.Track
member.summary: Content will be placed within the track itself.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.ZeroSizeContentControl
member.summary: Represents a that can return a zero width or height during its measuring pass.
member.remarks:
Use the HorizontalContentAlignment and VerticalContentAlignment properties to align the content with no width or height respectively.
For detailed documentation on this control's features and how to use them, please see the ZeroSizeContentControl documentation topic.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Rendering.TextProviderTranslateModes.PositiveTracking
member.summary: This flag can be combined with or . When used with , this flag indicates that the resulting character index should be negative (a bitwise complement) if the character index should have negative (leftward) affinity around a spacer; otherwise, a positive value indicates positive (rightward) affinity around a spacer. When used with , this flag indicates that the resulting character index should track positive (rightward) around any gap in characters scenario.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ProgressBarHighlightBrushConverter
member.summary: Represents a converter that can be used by a progress bar control to construct a that can be used to highlight a progress bar indicator.
member.remarks:
This converter expects the following source values to be specified:
Source Brush - A that should be used as a basis for the created by this converter.
Width - A that indicates the width of the progress bar.
Height - A that indicates the height of the progress bar.

example.code: <-- Below is an example definition of the PART_Indicator for the AnimatedProgressBar. A similar definition could be used for the ProgressBar control. --> <Rectangle x:Name="animation"> <Rectangle.OpacityMask> <MultiBinding> <MultiBinding.Converter> <themes:ProgressBarHighlightBrushConverter /> </MultiBinding.Converter> <Binding Path="Foreground" RelativeSource="{RelativeSource TemplatedParent}" /> <Binding Path="ActualWidth" ElementName="grid" /> <Binding Path="ActualHeight" ElementName="grid" /> </MultiBinding> </Rectangle.OpacityMask> </Rectangle>

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ProgressBarHighlightBrushConverter.Convert(System.Object[],System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts source values into a that can be used to render a progress bar indicator.
member.param: The array of values that the source bindings in the produces.
The type of the binding target property.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: A that can be used to render a progress bar indicator; otherwise .
member.remarks: See for more information on the expected source values.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ProgressBarHighlightBrushConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type[],System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: This method always returns and should not be used.
member.param: Not used.
Not used.
Not used.
Not used.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ProgressBarSegmentedBrushConverter
member.summary: Represents a converter that can be used by a progress bar control to construct a that can be used as an opacity mask for a segemented progress bar indicator.
member.remarks:
This converter expects the following source values to be specified:
Continuous - A that indicates whether the created is intended for use by a progress bar that has a continuous indicator.
Orientation - An that indicates the orientation of the progress bar.
Indicator Width - A that indicates the width of the progress bar indicator.
Indicator Height - A that indicates the height of the progress bar indicator.
Track Width - A that indicates the width of the progress bar track.
Track Height - A that indicates the hieght of the progress bar track.
Indeterminate - A that indicates whether the created is intended for use by a progress bar that is indeterminate.

example.code: <-- Below is an example definition of the PART_Indicator for the AnimatedProgressBar. A similar definition could be used for the ProgressBar control. --> <Rectangle x:Name="PART_Indicator"> <Rectangle.Fill> <MultiBinding> <MultiBinding.Converter> <themes:ProgressBarSegmentedBrushConverter /> </MultiBinding.Converter> <Binding Path="IsContinuous" RelativeSource="{RelativeSource TemplatedParent}" /> <Binding Path="Orientation" RelativeSource="{RelativeSource TemplatedParent}" /> <Binding Path="ActualWidth" ElementName="PART_Indicator" /> <Binding Path="ActualHeight" ElementName="PART_Indicator" /> <Binding Path="ActualWidth" ElementName="PART_Track" /> <Binding Path="ActualHeight" ElementName="PART_Track" /> <Binding Path="IsIndeterminate" RelativeSource="{RelativeSource TemplatedParent}" /> </MultiBinding> </Rectangle.Fill> </Rectangle>

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ProgressBarSegmentedBrushConverter.Convert(System.Object[],System.Type,System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Converts source values into a that can be used to render a progress bar indicator.
member.param: The array of values that the source bindings in the produces.
The type of the binding target property.
The converter parameter to use.
The culture to use in the converter.
member.returns: A that can be used to render a progress bar indicator; otherwise .
member.remarks: See for more information on the expected source values.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ProgressBarSegmentedBrushConverter.ConvertBack(System.Object,System.Type[],System.Object,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: This method always returns and should not be used.
member.param: Not used.
Not used.
Not used.
Not used.

member.summary: Gets or sets the mode to use for rendering the shadow, which determines if pure WPF rendering or shader effect-based rendering is used.
member.value: A indicating the mode to use for rendering the shadow. The default value is Default, which uses pure WPF rendering and is intended for a rectangular child's shadow.
member.remarks: Shader effects are slower and more resource intensive, but should be used when rendering a shadow for a non-rectangular child.

member.name: P:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ShadowChrome.ShadowOpacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the shadow.
member.value: The opacity of the shadow, a value from 0 to 1. The default value is 0.3.

member.summary: Gets the resolved Thickness of the shadow.
member.value: The resolved Thickness of the shadow.
member.remarks: When used as a Popup shadow, the popup may wish to increase its size by this amount to ensure the shadow can render.

member.name: T:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ShadowChromeRenderMode
member.summary: Spoecifies the render mode to use for a .

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ShadowChromeRenderMode.Default
member.summary: Use fast, pure WPF rendering to render the shadow without any shader effects. This option should only be used when the 's child is rectanglar.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ShadowChromeRenderMode.ShaderEffectsPreferred
member.summary: Use slower, but better-looking shader effects to render the shadow. On machines without graphics hardware acceleration, the Default render mode will be used instead.

member.name: F:ActiproSoftware.Windows.Controls.Primitives.ShadowChromeRenderMode.ShaderEffectsRequired
member.summary: Use slower, but better-looking shader effects to render the shadow. This option should be used when the 's child is non-rectangular since the Default render mode will not handle that scenario. On machines without graphics hardware acceleration, no shadows will be rendered.

member.summary: The highest log level for errors that prevent or break the normal application flow.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Compatibility.DrawingContextWrapper.Pop
member.summary: Pops the last opacity mask, opacity, clip, or transform operation that was pushed onto the drawing context.
member.remarks: Once an operation is popped, it is no longer applied to subsequent drawing commands.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Compatibility.DrawingContextWrapper.PushClip(System.Windows.Media.Geometry)
member.summary: Pushes the specified clip region onto the drawing context.
member.param: The clip region to apply to subsequent drawing commands.
member.remarks: The clip region applies to all subsequent drawing commands until it is removed by the command.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Compatibility.DrawingContextWrapper.PushOpacity(System.Double)
member.summary: Pushes the specified opacity setting onto the drawing context.
member.param: The opacity factor to apply to subsequent drawing commands. This factor is cumulative with previous operations.
member.remarks: The opacity is blended into all subsequent drawing commands until it is removed by the command.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Compatibility.DrawingContextWrapper.PushOpacityMask(System.Windows.Media.Brush)
member.summary: Pushes the specified opacity mask onto the drawing context.
member.param: The opacity mask to apply to subsequent drawings. The alpha values of this brush determine the opacity of the drawing to which it is applied.
member.remarks: The mask is applied to all subsequent drawing commands until it is removed by the command.

member.name: M:ActiproSoftware.Compatibility.DrawingContextWrapper.PushTransform(System.Windows.Media.Transform)
member.summary: Pushes the specified onto the drawing context.
member.param: The transform to apply to subsequent drawing commands.
member.remarks: The transform applies to all subsequent drawing commands until it is removed by the command.
